description: From New Latin squāmulōsus (“squamulose”), from Latin squamula (“small scales”) (diminutive of squāma (“scale of a fish or reptile; item shaped like a scale, flake”)) + -ōsus (suffix meaning ‘full of, prone to’). The English word is analysable as squamula +‎ -ose.

adjectives.description: squamulose (comparative more squamulose, superlative most squamulose)

examples: Synonyms: scaly, squamous; see also Thesaurus:scaly
The stem of the mushroom is squamulose.
